Welcome to asias_fds_profile documentation¶

‘asias_fds_profiles’ are a set of Python modules intended for use with Flight Data Services FlightDataAnalyzer.

Each module defines a themed set of measures, some of which correspond to ASIAS benchmarks.

As of Fall 2013, the profiles have been used in evaluation and testing against a limited set of test flights, and should not be regarded as fully mature.

Contents:

example_profile¶

example_profile defines a set of measure nodes that run against FDS FlightDataAnalyzer base data. All the major node types are covered. The emphasis is on manually constructing extremely simple measures, to better understand how the node types are structured.

There are also a couple of examples where the node is derived from other measures, which is the more typical case.

class example_profile.SimpleAttribute(*args, **kwargs)¶

A simple FlightAttribute constructed using the node.set_flight_attr() method. start_datetime is used only to provide a dependency, which appears to be a requirement.

class example_profile.FileAttribute(*args, **kwargs)¶
Tests availability of ‘Myfile’ filename attribute,
assigned by staged_helper.py via the aircraft_info dictionary.
class example_profile.MydictAttribute(*args, **kwargs)¶

a simple FlightAttribute to tests availability of Mydict, a dictionary that was assigned by staged_helper.

class example_profile.SimpleKTI(*args, **kwargs)¶

a simple KTI=Key Time Instance. start_datetime is used only to provide a dependency

class example_profile.SimplerKTI(*args, **kwargs)¶

manually built KTI, illustrating how KeyTimeInstanceNode act like a list of KTI objects.

class example_profile.SimpleKPV(*args, **kwargs)¶

a simple KPV. start_datetime is used only to provide a dependency

class example_profile.SimplerKPV(*args, **kwargs)¶

manually built KPV, illustrating how KeyPointValueNode act like a list of KPV objects. Also shows how a KPV node can contain KPV objects with different names.

class example_profile.TCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

Time of up or down advisory, a KTI based on TCAS Combined Control during the Airborne phase of flight.

class example_profile.InitialApproach(*args, **kwargs)¶

A phase of derived from the ‘Approach’ and ‘Final Appraoch’ phases. It covers the time interval from beginning of ‘Approach’ to beginning of ‘Final Approach’.

DistanceTravelledInAir(name='', array=masked_array(data = [],
mask = False,
fill_value = 1e+20)
, frequency=1, offset=0, data_type=None, *args, **kwargs)

A simple derived parameter, i.e. a derived time series. It may be used as an input to other calculations, but our current policy (Nov 2013) is not to store it to disk.

Exercises the FDS integrate() function to derive distance from airspeed. The calculation is limited to periods when the aircraft is not in the ‘Grounded’ phase of flight.

tcas_profile¶

TCAS Profile is a draft set of measures intended to roughly parallel existing ASIAS TCAS metrics. The profile also includes a number of nodes intended to help in diagnosing individual events, as an aid to both development and quality control.

class tcas_profile.TCASRASections(*args, **kwargs)¶
Sections of filtered TCAS RA alerts. Generally we use this rather than TCAS Combined Control to id alerts.
Currently filters are based on event duration and event timing relative to liftoff and touchdown.
class tcas_profile.TCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

A KTI delineating the start of each TCAS RA section.

class tcas_profile.TCASCtlSections(*args, **kwargs)¶

TCAS RA Combined Control sections. Currently we are relying primarily on ‘TCAS RA’ instead of Combined Control to ID RAs. In the future we might want to use both TCAS RA and Combined Control jointly.

TCASRAResponsePlot(name='', array=masked_array(data = [],
mask = False,
fill_value = 1e+20)
, frequency=1, offset=0, data_type=None, *args, **kwargs)

A dummy node to generate detailed time series plots of TCAS events to PROFILE_REPORTS_PATH.

class tcas_profile.TCASAltitudeExceedance(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV of vertical speed relative to Standard Response. Currently assumes 1 hz params.

TCASRAStandardResponse(name='', array=masked_array(data = [],
mask = False,
fill_value = 1e+20)
, frequency=1, offset=0, data_type=None, *args, **kwargs)

Time series of TCAS RA standard response in terms of vertial speed.

Standard pilot response is a vertical speed curve to use as a reference. Source for standard response time and acceleration:

“Introduction to TCAS II version 7.1”
Federal Aviation Administration, February 28, 2011. p. 39

Initial response time = 5 sec (2.5 sec for reversal)

Acceleration to advised vert speed = 8.0 ft^2 (reversal=11.2 ft/sec^2)

Maintain advised fpm until end.

class tcas_profile.TCASCombinedControl(*args, **kwargs)¶

Reports all Combined Control state changes, masked or not, to support event review

class tcas_profile.TCASUpAdvisory(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports all Up Advisory state changes, masked or not, to support event review.

class tcas_profile.TCASDownAdvisory(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports all Down Advisory state changes, masked or not, to support event review.

class tcas_profile.TCASVerticalControl(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports all Vertical Control state changes, masked or not, to support event review. Advisory is one of the following types: Crossing, Reversal, Increase, Maintain.

class tcas_profile.TCASSensitivity(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports all TCAS Sensitivity Model state changes, masked or not, to support event review.

class tcas_profile.TCASSensitivityAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports TCAS Sensitivity Mode at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.VerticalSpeedAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Vertical Speed at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.AltitudeQNHAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Altitude QNH at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.PitchAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Pitch Angle at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.RollAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Roll Angle at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.AirspeedAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Airspeed at the start of each RA.

class tcas_profile.AutopilotAtTCASRAStart(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports Autopilot status at the start of each RA. ‘1=Engaged, otherwise Disengaged

class tcas_profile.TCASRATimeToAPDisengage(*args, **kwargs)¶

KPV reports to disengage Autopilot after a TCAS RA. Adapted from FDS ‘TCAS RA To AP Disengaged Duration’, but uses TCAS RA Start to define events.

ua_profile¶

UA Profile is a draft set of measures to roughly parallel existing ASIAS UA metrics. The profile includes KPVs capturing instability across several criteria, including: ILS approach deviations (Glideslope, Localizer), airspeed deviations (high and low relative to Vref), high vertical speed, low power, late configuration changes (Gear and Flaps).

Derived Parameters¶

AirspeedReferenceVref(name='', array=masked_array(data = [],
mask = False,
fill_value = 1e+20)
, frequency=1, offset=0, data_type=None, *args, **kwargs)

Derived parameter used to create a time series of Vref values Logic looks for recorded Vref, followed by an AFR Vref, followed by a lookup table cross referencing gross weight and flap position

ILS Approaches¶

class UA_profile.GlideslopeDeviation5Sec1000To500FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine maximum deviation from the glideslope between 1000 and 500 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

class UA_profile.GlideslopeDeviation5Sec500To200FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine maximum deviation from the glideslope between 500 and 200 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

class UA_profile.GlideslopeDeviation5Sec1000To500FtMin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine minimium deviation from the glideslope between 1000 and 500 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

class UA_profile.GlideslopeDeviation5Sec500To200FtMin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine minimium deviation from the glideslope between 500 and 200 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

class UA_profile.LocalizerDeviation5Sec1000To500FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine maximum absolute deviation from the localizer between 1000 and 500 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

class UA_profile.LocalizerDeviation5Sec500To50FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Determine maximum absolute deviation from the localizer between 500 and 50 ft.

## MITRE edit: ILS established assumes that the aircraft was aligned then deviated, we want the full range

Speeds¶

class UA_profile.AirspeedRelativeMax3Sec1000to500ftHAT(*args, **kwargs)¶

CAS-Vref 1000 to 500 ft HAT

class UA_profile.AirspeedRelativeMax3Sec500to50ftHAT(*args, **kwargs)¶

CAS-Vref 500 to 50 ft HAT

class UA_profile.AirspeedRelativeMin3Sec1000to500ftHAT(*args, **kwargs)¶

CAS-Vref 1000 to 500 ft HAT

class UA_profile.AirspeedRelativeMin3Sec500to50ftHAT(*args, **kwargs)¶

CAS-Vref 500 to 50 ft HAT

Vertical Speed¶

class UA_profile.RateOfDescent3Sec1000To500FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Max rate of descent from 1000 to 500 ft HAT

class UA_profile.RateOfDescent3Sec500To50FtMax(*args, **kwargs)¶

Max rate of descent from 500 to 50 ft HAT

Engine Speed¶

class UA_profile.EngN15Sec1000To500FtMin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Min engine N1 from 1000 to 500 ft HAT

class UA_profile.EngN15Sec500To50FtMin(*args, **kwargs)¶

Min engine N1 from 500 to 50 ft HAT

Configuration¶

Flap position change is embedded in FDS’ base kpv values, named “AltitudeAtLastFlapChangeBeforeTouchdown”

class UA_profile.AltitudeAtLastGearDownBeforeTouchdown(*args, **kwargs)¶

Altitude at last gear movement
